column5: Anyone got any links to good write-ups on reading (and adjusting to) specific water conditions? In the last year I've spent a lot of time just throwing lures and bait in the water without really considering what might work best in a given situation. Umm like I learned this year that if the water is murky, try bigger beads, for example. But there's got to be some good comprehensive articles out there.  thx

If it looks like a double/double from Tim Hortons, go home..  What is more important is actually reading the river...  Steams, tailouts, etc etc..  When you can figure out where those are, you'll be catching a lot more fish.
